statement:
Let $D$ be an open subset of $\mathbb{R}^n$. If, for a sequence of
functions $f_i \colon D \to \mathbb{R}$, $i = 1,2,\ldots$ there exists a
constant $B>0$ such that
$$(\forall i) \qquad \| f_i \|_{L^2 (D)} = \int_D f_i^2 \, d^n x < B$$
and
$$(\forall i) \, (\forall j \in \{1, \ldots n \}) \qquad \int_D \left( {\partial f_i \over \partial x_j} \right)^2 \, d^n x < B$$
then there exists a subsequence which is convergent in the $L^2 (D)$
norm.
